   20: -module(trycatch_no_copt_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,basic/1,lean_throw/1,
   24: 	 try_of/1,try_after/1,
   25: 	 catch_oops/1,after_oops/1,eclectic/1,rethrow/1,
   26: 	 nested_of/1,nested_catch/1,nested_after/1,
   27: 	 nested_horrid/1,last_call_optimization/1,bool/1,
   28: 	 andalso_orelse/1,get_in_try/1,
   29: 	 hockey/1,handle_info/1,catch_in_catch/1,grab_bag/1,
   30:          stacktrace/1,nested_stacktrace/1,raise/1,
   31:          no_return_in_try_block/1,
   32:          expression_export/1,
   33:          throw_opt_crash/1,
   34:          coverage/1,
   35:          throw_opt_funs/1]).
   36: 
   37: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   38: 
   39: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   40: 
   41: all() -> 
   42:     [{group,p}].
   43: 
   44: groups() -> 
   45:     [{p,[parallel],
   46:       [basic,lean_throw,try_of,try_after,catch_oops,
   47:        after_oops,eclectic,rethrow,nested_of,nested_catch,
   48:        nested_after,nested_horrid,last_call_optimization,
   49:        bool,andalso_orelse,get_in_try,
   50:        hockey,handle_info,catch_in_catch,grab_bag,
   51:        stacktrace,nested_stacktrace,raise,
   52:        no_return_in_try_block,expression_export,
   53:        throw_opt_crash,
   54:        coverage,
   55:        throw_opt_funs]}].
   56: 
   57: 
   58: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   59:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   63:     ok.
   64: 
   65: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   66:     Config.
   67: 
   68: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: 
   72: 
   73: basic(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
   74:     2 =
   75: 	try my_div(4, 2)
   76: 	catch 
   77:             Class:Reason -> {Class,Reason}
   78: 	end,
   79:     error =
   80:         try my_div(1, 0)
   81:         catch 
   82:             error:badarith -> error
   83:         end,
   84:     error =
   85:         try 1.0 / zero()
   86:         catch 
   87:             error:badarith -> error
   88:         end,
   89:     ok =
   90:         try my_add(53, atom)
   91:         catch
   92:             error:badarith -> ok
   93:         end,
   94:     exit_nisse =
   95:         try exit(nisse)
   96: 	catch 
   97:             exit:nisse -> exit_nisse
   98:         end,
   99:     ok =
  100:         try throw(kalle)
  101:         catch
  102:             kalle -> ok
  103:         end,
  104: 
  105:     %% Try some stuff where the compiler will optimize away the try.
  106: 
  107:     V = id({a,variable}),
  108:     V = try V catch nisse -> error end,
  109:     42 = try 42 catch nisse -> error end,
  110:     [V] = try [V] catch nisse -> error end,
  111:     {ok,V} = try {ok,V} catch nisse -> error end,
  112: 
  113:     %% Same idea, but use an after too.
  114: 
  115:     V = try V catch nisse -> error after after_call() end,
  116:     after_clean(),
  117:     42 = try 42 after after_call() end,
  118:     after_clean(),
  119:     [V] = try [V] catch nisse -> error after after_call() end,
  120:     after_clean(),
  121:     {ok,V} = try {ok,V} after after_call() end,
  122: 
  123:     %% Try/of
  124:     ok = try V of
  125: 	     {a,variable} -> ok
  126: 	 catch nisse -> error
  127: 	 end,
  128: 
  129:     %% Unmatchable clauses.
  130:     try
  131:         throw(thrown)
  132:     catch
  133:         {a,b}={a,b,c} ->                        %Intentionally no match.
  134:             ok;
  135:         thrown ->
  136:             ok
  137:     end,
  138: 
  139:     ok.
  140: 
  141: after_call() ->
  142:     put(basic, after_was_called).
  143: 
  144: after_clean() ->
  145:     after_was_called = erase(basic).
  146:     
  147: 
  148: lean_throw(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  149:     {throw,kalle} =
  150:         try throw(kalle)
  151:         catch
  152:             Kalle -> {throw,Kalle}
  153:         end,
  154:     {exit,kalle} =
  155:         try exit(kalle)
  156:         catch
  157:             Throw1 -> {throw,Throw1};
  158: 	    exit:Reason1 -> {exit,Reason1}
  159:         end,
  160:     {exit,kalle} =
  161:         try exit(kalle)
  162:         catch
  163: 	    exit:Reason2 -> {exit,Reason2};
  164:             Throw2 -> {throw,Throw2}
  165:         end,
  166:     {exit,kalle} =
  167:         try try exit(kalle)
  168:             catch
  169:                 Throw3 -> {throw,Throw3}
  170:             end
  171:         catch
  172:             exit:Reason3 -> {exit,Reason3}
  173:         end,
  174:     ok.
  175: 
  176: 
  177: 
  178: try_of(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  179:     {ok,{some,content}} =
  180: 	try_of_1({value,{good,{some,content}}}),
  181:     {error,[other,content]} =
  182: 	try_of_1({value,{bad,[other,content]}}),
  183:     {caught,{exit,{ex,it,[reason]}}} =
  184: 	try_of_1({exit,{ex,it,[reason]}}),
  185:     {caught,{throw,[term,{in,a,{tuple}}]}} =
  186: 	try_of_1({throw,[term,{in,a,{tuple}}]}),
  187:     {caught,{error,[bad,arg]}} =
  188: 	try_of_1({error,[bad,arg]}),
  189:     {caught,{error,badarith}} =
  190: 	try_of_1({'div',{1,0}}),
  191:     {caught,{error,badarith}} =
  192: 	try_of_1({'add',{a,0}}),
  193:     {caught,{error,badarg}} =
  194: 	try_of_1({'abs',x}),
  195:     {caught,{error,function_clause}} =
  196: 	try_of_1(illegal),
  197:     {error,{try_clause,{some,other_garbage}}} =
  198: 	try try_of_1({value,{some,other_garbage}})
  199:         catch error:Reason -> {error,Reason}
  200:         end,
  201:     ok.
  202: 
  203: try_of_1(X) ->
  204:     try foo(X) of
  205:         {good,Y} -> {ok,Y};
  206: 	{bad,Y} -> {error,Y}
  207:     catch
  208: 	Class:Reason ->
  209:              {caught,{Class,Reason}}
  210:     end.
  211: 
  212: try_after(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  213:     try_after_1(fun try_after_basic/2),
  214:     try_after_1(fun try_after_catch/2),
  215:     try_after_1(fun try_after_complex/2),
  216:     try_after_1(fun try_after_fun/2),
  217:     try_after_1(fun try_after_letrec/2),
  218:     try_after_1(fun try_after_protect/2),
  219:     try_after_1(fun try_after_receive/2),
  220:     try_after_1(fun try_after_receive_timeout/2),
  221:     try_after_1(fun try_after_try/2),
  222:     ok.
  223: 
  224: try_after_1(TestFun) ->
  225:     {{ok,[some,value],undefined},finalized} =
  226:         TestFun({value,{ok,[some,value]}},finalized),
  227:     {{error,badarith,undefined},finalized} =
  228:         TestFun({'div',{1,0}},finalized),
  229:     {{error,badarith,undefined},finalized} =
  230:         TestFun({'add',{1,a}},finalized),
  231:     {{error,badarg,undefined},finalized} =
  232:         TestFun({'abs',a},finalized),
  233:     {{error,[the,{reason}],undefined},finalized} =
  234:         TestFun({error,[the,{reason}]},finalized),
  235:     {{throw,{thrown,[reason]},undefined},finalized} =
  236:         TestFun({throw,{thrown,[reason]}},finalized),
  237:     {{exit,{exited,{reason}},undefined},finalized} =
  238:         TestFun({exit,{exited,{reason}}},finalized),
  239:     {{error,function_clause,undefined},finalized} =
  240:         TestFun(function_clause,finalized),
  241:     ok =
  242:         try
  243:             TestFun({'add',{1,1}}, finalized)
  244:         catch
  245:             error:{try_clause,2} -> ok
  246:         end,
  247:     finalized = erase(try_after),
  248:     ok =
  249:         try
  250:             try
  251:                 foo({exit,[reaso,{n}]})
  252:             after
  253:                 put(try_after, finalized)
  254:             end
  255:         catch
  256:             exit:[reaso,{n}] -> ok
  257:         end,
  258:     ok.
  259: 
  260: -define(TRY_AFTER_TESTCASE(Block),
  261:     erase(try_after),
  262:     Try =
  263:         try foo(X) of
  264:             {ok,Value} -> {ok,Value,get(try_after)}
  265:         catch
  266:             Reason -> {throw,Reason,get(try_after)};
  267:             error:Reason -> {error,Reason,get(try_after)};
  268:             exit:Reason ->  {exit,Reason,get(try_after)}
  269:         after
  270:             Block,
  271:             put(try_after, Y)
  272:         end,
  273:     {Try,erase(try_after)}).
  274: 
  275: try_after_basic(X, Y) ->
  276:     ?TRY_AFTER_TESTCASE(ok).
  277: 
  278: try_after_catch(X, Y) ->
  279:     ?TRY_AFTER_TESTCASE((catch put(try_after, Y))).
  280: 
  281: try_after_complex(X, Y) ->
  282:     %% Large 'after' block, going above the threshold for wrapper functions.
  283:     ?TRY_AFTER_TESTCASE(case get(try_after) of
  284:                             unreachable_0 -> dummy:unreachable_0();
  285:                             unreachable_1 -> dummy:unreachable_1();
  286:                             unreachable_2 -> dummy:unreachable_2();
  287:                             unreachable_3 -> dummy:unreachable_3();
  288:                             unreachable_4 -> dummy:unreachable_4();
  289:                             unreachable_5 -> dummy:unreachable_5();
  290:                             unreachable_6 -> dummy:unreachable_6();
  291:                             unreachable_7 -> dummy:unreachable_7();
  292:                             unreachable_8 -> dummy:unreachable_8();
  293:                             unreachable_9 -> dummy:unreachable_9();
  294:                             _ -> put(try_after, Y)
  295:                         end).
  296: 
  297: try_after_fun(X, Y) ->
  298:     ?TRY_AFTER_TESTCASE((fun() -> ok end)()).
  299: 
  300: try_after_letrec(X, Y) ->
  301:     List = lists:duplicate(100, ok),
  302:     ?TRY_AFTER_TESTCASE([L || L <- List]).
  303: 
  304: try_after_protect(X, Y) ->
  305:     ?TRY_AFTER_TESTCASE(case get(try_after) of
  306:                             N when element(52, N) < 32 -> ok;
  307:                             _ -> ok
  308:                         end).
  309: 
  310: try_after_receive(X, Y) ->
  311:     Ref = make_ref(),
  312:     self() ! Ref,
  313:     ?TRY_AFTER_TESTCASE(receive
  314:                             Ref -> Ref
  315:                         end).
  316: 
  317: try_after_receive_timeout(X, Y) ->
  318:     Ref = make_ref(),
  319:     self() ! Ref,
  320:     ?TRY_AFTER_TESTCASE(receive
  321:                             Ref -> Ref
  322:                         after 1000 -> ok
  323:                         end).
  324: 
  325: try_after_try(X, Y) ->
  326:     ?TRY_AFTER_TESTCASE(try
  327:                             put(try_after, Y)
  328:                         catch
  329:                             _ -> ok
  330:                         end).
  331: 
  332: catch_oops(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  333:     V = {v,[a,l|u],{e},self()},
  334:     {value,V} = catch_oops_1({value,V}),
  335:     {value,1} = catch_oops_1({'div',{1,1}}),
  336:     {error,badarith} = catch_oops_1({'div',{1,0}}),
  337:     {error,function_clause} = catch_oops_1(function_clause),
  338:     {throw,V} = catch_oops_1({throw,V}),
  339:     {exit,V} = catch_oops_1({exit,V}),
  340:     ok.
  341: 
  342: catch_oops_1(X) ->
  343:     Ref = make_ref(),
  344:     try try foo({error,Ref})
  345:         catch
  346:             error:Ref ->
  347: 	        foo(X)
  348:         end of
  349:         Value -> {value,Value}
  350:     catch
  351:         Class:Data -> {Class,Data}
  352:     end.
  353: 
  354: 
  355: 
  356: after_oops(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  357:     V = {self(),make_ref()},
  358: 
  359:     {{value,V},V} = after_oops_1({value,V}, {value,V}),
  360:     {{exit,V},V} = after_oops_1({exit,V}, {value,V}),
  361:     {{error,V},undefined} = after_oops_1({value,V}, {error,V}),
  362:     {{error,function_clause},undefined} =
  363:         after_oops_1({exit,V}, function_clause),
  364: 
  365:     {{value,V},V} = after_oops_2({value,V}, {value,V}),
  366:     {{exit,V},V} = after_oops_2({exit,V}, {value,V}),
  367:     {{error,V},undefined} = after_oops_2({value,V}, {error,V}),
  368:     {{error,function_clause},undefined} =
  369:         after_oops_2({exit,V}, function_clause),
  370: 
  371:     ok.
  372: 
  373: after_oops_1(X, Y) ->
  374:     erase(after_oops),
  375:     Try =
  376:         try try foo(X)
  377:             after
  378:                 put(after_oops, foo(Y))
  379:             end of
  380:             V -> {value,V}
  381:         catch
  382:             C:D -> {C,D}
  383:         end,
  384:     {Try,erase(after_oops)}.
  385: 
  386: after_oops_2(X, Y) ->
  387:     %% GH-4859: `raw_raise` never got an edge to its catch block, making
  388:     %% try/catch optimization unsafe.
  389:     erase(after_oops),
  390:     Try =
  391:         try
  392:             try
  393:                 foo(X)
  394:             catch E:R:S ->
  395:                 erlang:raise(E, R, S)
  396:             after
  397:                 put(after_oops, foo(Y))
  398:             end
  399:         of
  400:             V -> {value,V}
  401:         catch
  402:             C:D -> {C,D}
  403:         end,
  404:     {Try,erase(after_oops)}.
  405: 
  406: eclectic(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  407:     V = {make_ref(),3.1415926535,[[]|{}]},
  408:     {{value,{value,V},V},V} =
  409: 	eclectic_1({foo,{value,{value,V}}}, undefined, {value,V}),
  410:     {{'EXIT',{V,[{?MODULE,foo,1,_}|_]}},V} =
  411: 	eclectic_1({catch_foo,{error,V}}, undefined, {value,V}),
  412:     {{error,{exit,V},{'EXIT',V}},V} =
  413: 	eclectic_1({foo,{error,{exit,V}}}, error, {value,V}),
  414:     {{value,{value,V},V},
  415: 	   {'EXIT',{badarith,[{erlang,'+',[0,a],_},{?MODULE,my_add,2,_}|_]}}} =
  416: 	eclectic_1({foo,{value,{value,V}}}, undefined, {'add',{0,a}}),
  417:     {{'EXIT',V},V} =
  418: 	eclectic_1({catch_foo,{exit,V}}, undefined, {throw,V}),
  419:     {{error,{'div',{1,0}},{'EXIT',{badarith,[{erlang,'div',[1,0],_},{?MODULE,my_div,2,_}|_]}}},
  420: 	   {'EXIT',V}} =
  421: 	eclectic_1({foo,{error,{'div',{1,0}}}}, error, {exit,V}),
  422:     {{{error,V},{'EXIT',{V,[{?MODULE,foo,1,_}|_]}}},
  423: 	   {'EXIT',V}} =
  424: 	eclectic_1({catch_foo,{throw,{error,V}}}, undefined, {exit,V}),
  425:     %%
  426:     {{value,{value,{value,V},V}},V} =
  427: 	eclectic_2({value,{value,V}}, undefined, {value,V}),
  428:     {{value,{throw,{value,V},V}},V} =
  429: 	eclectic_2({throw,{value,V}}, throw, {value,V}),
  430:     {{caught,{'EXIT',V}},undefined} =
  431: 	eclectic_2({value,{value,V}}, undefined, {exit,V}),
  432:     {{caught,{'EXIT',{V,[{?MODULE,foo,1,_}|_]}}},undefined} =
  433: 	eclectic_2({error,{value,V}}, throw, {error,V}),
  434:     {{caught,{'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,abs,[V],_}|_]}}},V} =
  435: 	eclectic_2({value,{'abs',V}}, undefined, {value,V}),
  436:     {{caught,{'EXIT',{badarith,[{erlang,'+',[0,a],_},{?MODULE,my_add,2,_}|_]}}},V} =
  437: 	eclectic_2({exit,{'add',{0,a}}}, exit, {value,V}),
  438:     {{caught,{'EXIT',V}},undefined} =
  439: 	eclectic_2({value,{error,V}}, undefined, {exit,V}),
  440:     {{caught,{'EXIT',{V,[{?MODULE,foo,1,_}|_]}}},undefined} =
  441: 	eclectic_2({throw,{'div',{1,0}}}, throw, {error,V}),
  442:     ok.
  443: 
  444: eclectic_1(X, C, Y) ->
  445:     erase(eclectic),
  446:     Done = make_ref(),
  447:     Try =
  448:         try case X of
  449: 		{catch_foo,V} -> catch {Done,foo(V)};
  450: 		{foo,V} -> {Done,foo(V)}
  451: 	    end of
  452:             {Done,D} -> {value,D,catch foo(D)};
  453: 	    {'EXIT',_}=Exit -> Exit;
  454: 	    D -> {D,catch foo(D)}
  455:         catch
  456:             C:D -> {C,D,catch foo(D)}
  457:         after
  458:             put(eclectic, catch foo(Y))
  459:         end,
  460:     {Try,erase(eclectic)}.
  461: 
  462: eclectic_2(X, C, Y) ->
  463:     Done = make_ref(),
  464:     erase(eclectic),
  465:     Catch =
  466: 	case 
  467:             catch
  468: 		{Done,
  469: 		 try foo(X) of
  470: 		     V -> {value,V,foo(V)}
  471: 		 catch
  472: 		     C:D -> {C,D,foo(D)}
  473: 		 after
  474: 		     put(eclectic, foo(Y))
  475: 		 end} of
  476: 		{Done,Z} -> {value,Z};
  477: 		Z -> {caught,Z}
  478: 	    end,
  479:     {Catch,erase(eclectic)}.
  480: 
  481: 
  482: 
  483: rethrow(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  484:     V = {a,[b,{c,self()},make_ref]},
  485:     {value2,value1} =
  486: 	rethrow_1({value,V}, V),
  487:     {caught2,{error,V}} =
  488: 	rethrow_2({error,V}, undefined),
  489:     {caught2,{exit,V}} =
  490: 	rethrow_1({exit,V}, error),
  491:     {caught2,{throw,V}} =
  492: 	rethrow_1({throw,V}, undefined),
  493:     {caught2,{throw,V}} =
  494: 	rethrow_2({throw,V}, undefined),
  495:     {caught2,{error,badarith}} =
  496: 	rethrow_1({'add',{0,a}}, throw),
  497:     {caught2,{error,function_clause}} =
  498: 	rethrow_2(function_clause, undefined),
  499:     {caught2,{error,{try_clause,V}}} =
  500: 	rethrow_1({value,V}, exit),
  501:     {value2,{caught1,V}} =
  502: 	rethrow_1({error,V}, error),
  503:     {value2,{caught1,V}} =
  504: 	rethrow_1({exit,V}, exit),
  505:     {value2,caught1} =
  506: 	rethrow_2({throw,V}, V),
  507:     ok.
  508: 
  509: rethrow_1(X, C1) ->
  510:     try try foo(X) of
  511:             C1 -> value1
  512:         catch
  513:             C1:D1 -> {caught1,D1}
  514:         end of
  515:         V2 -> {value2,V2}
  516:     catch
  517:         C2:D2 -> {caught2,{C2,D2}}
  518:     end.
  519: 
  520: rethrow_2(X, C1) ->
  521:     try try foo(X) of
  522:             C1 -> value1
  523:         catch
  524:             C1 -> caught1 % Implicit class throw:
  525:         end of
  526:         V2 -> {value2,V2}
  527:     catch
  528:         C2:D2 -> {caught2,{C2,D2}}
  529:     end.
  530: 
  531: 
  532: 
  533: nested_of(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  534:     V = {[self()|make_ref()],1.4142136},
  535:     {{value,{value1,{V,x2}}},
  536:      {V,x3},
  537:      {V,x4},
  538:      finalized} =
  539: 	nested_of_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  540: 		    {value,{V,x2}}, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  541:     {{caught,{throw,{V,x2}}},
  542:      {V,x3},
  543:      {V,x4},
  544:      finalized} =
  545: 	nested_of_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  546: 		    {throw,{V,x2}}, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  547:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  548:      undefined,
  549:      {V,x4},
  550:      finalized} =
  551: 	nested_of_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  552: 		    {throw,{V,x2}}, {'div',{1,0}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  553:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  554:      undefined,
  555:      undefined,
  556:      finalized} =
  557: 	nested_of_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  558: 		    {throw,{V,x2}}, {'div',{1,0}}, {'add',{0,b}}),
  559:     %%
  560:     {{caught,{error,{try_clause,{V,x1}}}},
  561:      {V,x3},
  562:      {V,x4},
  563:      finalized} =
  564: 	nested_of_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,try_clause},
  565: 		    void, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  566:     {{caught,{exit,{V,x3}}},
  567:      undefined,
  568:      {V,x4},
  569:      finalized} =
  570: 	nested_of_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,try_clause},
  571: 		    void, {exit,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  572:     {{caught,{throw,{V,x4}}},
  573:      undefined,
  574:      undefined,
  575:      finalized} =
  576: 	nested_of_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,try_clause},
  577: 		    void, {exit,{V,x3}}, {throw,{V,x4}}),
  578:     %%
  579:     {{value,{caught1,{V,x2}}},
  580:      {V,x3},
  581:      {V,x4},
  582:      finalized} =
  583: 	nested_of_1({{error,{V,x1}},error,{V,x1}},
  584: 		    {value,{V,x2}}, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  585:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  586:      {V,x3},
  587:      {V,x4},
  588:      finalized} =
  589: 	nested_of_1({{error,{V,x1}},error,{V,x1}},
  590: 		    {'add',{1,c}}, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  591:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  592:      undefined,
  593:      {V,x4},
  594:      finalized} =
  595: 	nested_of_1({{error,{V,x1}},error,{V,x1}},
  596: 		    {'add',{1,c}}, {'div',{17,0}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  597:     {{caught,{error,badarg}},
  598:      undefined,
  599:      undefined,
  600:      finalized} =
  601: 	nested_of_1({{error,{V,x1}},error,{V,x1}},
  602: 		    {'add',{1,c}}, {'div',{17,0}}, {'abs',V}),
  603:     %%
  604:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  605:      {V,x3},
  606:      {V,x4},
  607:      finalized} =
  608: 	nested_of_1({{'add',{2,c}},rethrow,void},
  609: 		    void, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  610:     {{caught,{error,badarg}},
  611:      undefined,
  612:      {V,x4},
  613:      finalized} =
  614: 	nested_of_1({{'add',{2,c}},rethrow,void},
  615: 		    void, {'abs',V}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  616:     {{caught,{error,function_clause}},
  617:      undefined,
  618:      undefined,
  619:      finalized} =
  620: 	nested_of_1({{'add',{2,c}},rethrow,void},
  621: 		    void, {'abs',V}, function_clause),
  622:     ok.
  623: 
  624: nested_of_1({X1,C1,V1},
  625: 	    X2, X3, X4) ->
  626:     erase(nested3),
  627:     erase(nested4),
  628:     erase(nested),
  629:     Self = self(),
  630:     Try =
  631: 	try
  632:             try self()
  633:             of
  634:                 Self ->
  635:                     try 
  636:                         foo(X1) 
  637: 	            of
  638: 	                V1 -> {value1,foo(X2)}
  639:                     catch
  640:                         C1:V1 -> {caught1,foo(X2)}
  641: 	            after
  642:                         put(nested3, foo(X3))
  643:                     end
  644:             after
  645:                 put(nested4, foo(X4))
  646:             end
  647:         of
  648:             V -> {value,V}
  649:         catch
  650:             C:D -> {caught,{C,D}}
  651:         after
  652:             put(nested, finalized)
  653: 	end,
  654:     {Try,erase(nested3),erase(nested4),erase(nested)}.
  655: 
  656: 
  657: 
  658: nested_catch(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  659:     V = {[make_ref(),1.4142136,self()]},
  660:     {{value,{value1,{V,x2}}},
  661:      {V,x3},
  662:      {V,x4},
  663:      finalized} =
  664: 	nested_catch_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  665: 		       {value,{V,x2}}, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  666:     {{caught,{throw,{V,x2}}},
  667:      {V,x3},
  668:      {V,x4},
  669:      finalized} =
  670: 	nested_catch_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  671: 		       {throw,{V,x2}}, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  672:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  673:      undefined,
  674:      {V,x4},
  675:      finalized} =
  676: 	nested_catch_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  677: 		       {throw,{V,x2}}, {'div',{1,0}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  678:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  679:      undefined,
  680:      undefined,
  681:      finalized} =
  682: 	nested_catch_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  683: 		       {throw,{V,x2}}, {'div',{1,0}}, {'add',{0,b}}),
  684:     %%
  685:     {{caught,{error,{try_clause,{V,x1}}}},
  686:      {V,x3},
  687:      {V,x4},
  688:      finalized} =
  689: 	nested_catch_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,try_clause},
  690: 		       void, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  691:     {{caught,{exit,{V,x3}}},
  692:      undefined,
  693:      {V,x4},
  694:      finalized} =
  695: 	nested_catch_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,try_clause},
  696: 		       void, {exit,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  697:     {{caught,{throw,{V,x4}}},
  698:      undefined,
  699:      undefined,
  700:      finalized} =
  701: 	nested_catch_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,try_clause},
  702: 		       void, {exit,{V,x3}}, {throw,{V,x4}}),
  703:     %%
  704:     {{value,{caught1,{V,x2}}},
  705:      {V,x3},
  706:      {V,x4},
  707:      finalized} =
  708: 	nested_catch_1({{error,{V,x1}},error,{V,x1}},
  709: 		       {value,{V,x2}}, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  710:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  711:      {V,x3},
  712:      {V,x4},
  713:      finalized} =
  714: 	nested_catch_1({{error,{V,x1}},error,{V,x1}},
  715: 		       {'add',{1,c}}, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  716:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  717:      undefined,
  718:      {V,x4},
  719:      finalized} =
  720: 	nested_catch_1({{error,{V,x1}},error,{V,x1}},
  721: 		       {'add',{1,c}}, {'div',{17,0}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  722:     {{caught,{error,badarg}},
  723:      undefined,
  724:      undefined,
  725:      finalized} =
  726: 	nested_catch_1({{error,{V,x1}},error,{V,x1}},
  727: 		       {'add',{1,c}}, {'div',{17,0}}, {'abs',V}),
  728:     %%
  729:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  730:      {V,x3},
  731:      {V,x4},
  732:      finalized} =
  733: 	nested_catch_1({{'add',{2,c}},rethrow,void},
  734: 		       void, {value,{V,x3}}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  735:     {{caught,{error,badarg}},
  736:      undefined,
  737:      {V,x4},
  738:      finalized} =
  739: 	nested_catch_1({{'add',{2,c}},rethrow,void},
  740: 		       void, {'abs',V}, {value,{V,x4}}),
  741:     {{caught,{error,function_clause}},
  742:      undefined,
  743:      undefined,
  744:      finalized} =
  745: 	nested_catch_1({{'add',{2,c}},rethrow,void},
  746: 		       void, {'abs',V}, function_clause),
  747:     ok.
  748: 
  749: nested_catch_1({X1,C1,V1},
  750: 	    X2, X3, X4) ->
  751:     erase(nested3),
  752:     erase(nested4),
  753:     erase(nested),
  754:     Throw = make_ref(),
  755:     Try =
  756: 	try
  757:             try throw(Throw)
  758:             catch
  759: 		Throw ->
  760:                     try 
  761:                         foo(X1) 
  762: 	            of
  763: 	                V1 -> {value1,foo(X2)}
  764:                     catch
  765:                         C1:V1 -> {caught1,foo(X2)}
  766: 	            after
  767:                         put(nested3, foo(X3))
  768:                     end
  769:             after
  770:                 put(nested4, foo(X4))
  771:             end
  772:         of
  773:             V -> {value,V}
  774:         catch
  775:             C:D -> {caught,{C,D}}
  776:         after
  777:             put(nested, finalized)
  778: 	end,
  779:     {Try,erase(nested3),erase(nested4),erase(nested)}.
  780:

  783: nested_after(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  784:     V = [{make_ref(),1.4142136,self()}],
  785:     {value,
  786: 	   {V,x3},
  787: 	   {value1,{V,x2}},
  788: 	   finalized} =
  789: 	nested_after_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  790: 		       {value,{V,x2}}, {value,{V,x3}}),
  791:     {{caught,{error,{V,x2}}},
  792: 	   {V,x3},
  793: 	   undefined,
  794: 	   finalized} =
  795: 	nested_after_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  796: 		       {error,{V,x2}}, {value,{V,x3}}),
  797:     {{caught,{exit,{V,x3}}},
  798: 	   undefined,
  799: 	   undefined,
  800: 	   finalized} =
  801: 	nested_after_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
  802: 		       {error,{V,x2}}, {exit,{V,x3}}),
  803:     %%
  804:     {{caught,{error,{try_clause,{V,x1}}}},
  805: 	   {V,x3},
  806: 	   undefined,
  807: 	   finalized} =
  808: 	nested_after_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,try_clause},
  809: 		       void, {value,{V,x3}}),
  810:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  811: 	   undefined,
  812: 	   undefined,
  813: 	   finalized} =
  814: 	nested_after_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,try_clause},
  815: 		       void, {'div',{17,0}}),
  816:     %%
  817:     {value,
  818: 	   {V,x3},
  819: 	   {caught1,{V,x2}},
  820: 	   finalized} =
  821: 	nested_after_1({{throw,{V,x1}},throw,{V,x1}},
  822: 		       {value,{V,x2}}, {value,{V,x3}}),
  823:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  824: 	   {V,x3},
  825: 	   undefined,
  826: 	   finalized} =
  827: 	nested_after_1({{throw,{V,x1}},throw,{V,x1}},
  828: 		       {'add',{a,b}}, {value,{V,x3}}),
  829:     {{caught,{error,badarg}},
  830: 	   undefined,
  831: 	   undefined,
  832: 	   finalized} =
  833: 	nested_after_1({{throw,{V,x1}},throw,{V,x1}},
  834: 		       {'add',{a,b}}, {'abs',V}),
  835:     %%
  836:     {{caught,{throw,{V,x1}}},
  837: 	   {V,x3},
  838: 	   undefined,
  839: 	   finalized} =
  840: 	nested_after_1({{throw,{V,x1}},rethrow,void},
  841: 		       void, {value,{V,x3}}),
  842:     {{caught,{error,badarith}},
  843: 	   undefined,
  844: 	   undefined,
  845: 	   finalized} =
  846: 	nested_after_1({{throw,{V,x1}},rethrow,void},
  847: 		       void, {'div',{1,0}}),
  848:     ok.
  849: 
  850: nested_after_1({X1,C1,V1},
  851: 	    X2, X3) ->
  852:     erase(nested3),
  853:     erase(nested4),
  854:     erase(nested),
  855:     Self = self(),
  856:     Try =
  857: 	try
  858:             try self()
  859:             after
  860:                 After =
  861:                     try 
  862:                         foo(X1) 
  863: 	            of
  864: 	                V1 -> {value1,foo(X2)}
  865:                     catch
  866:                         C1:V1 -> {caught1,foo(X2)}
  867: 	            after
  868:                         put(nested3, foo(X3))
  869:                     end,
  870:                 put(nested4, After)
  871:             end
  872:         of
  873:             Self -> value
  874:         catch
  875:             C:D -> {caught,{C,D}}
  876:         after
  877:             put(nested, finalized)
  878: 	end,
  879:     {Try,erase(nested3),erase(nested4),erase(nested)}.
  880: 
  881: 
  882: 
  883: nested_horrid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  884:     {[true,true],{[true,1.0],1.0}} =
  885: 	nested_horrid_1({true,void,void}, 1.0),
  886:     ok.
  887: 
  888: nested_horrid_1({X1,C1,V1}, X2) ->
  889:     try A1 = [X1,X1],
  890: 	B1 = if X1 ->
  891: 		     A2 = [X1,X2],
  892: 		     B2 = foo(X2),
  893: 		     {A2,B2};
  894: 		true ->
  895: 		     A3 = [X2,X1],
  896: 		     B3 = foo(X2),
  897: 		     {A3,B3}
  898: 	     end,
  899: 	{A1,B1}
  900:     catch
  901: 	C1:V1 -> caught1
  902:     end.
  903: 
  904: 
  905: 
  906: foo({value,Value}) -> Value;
  907: foo({'div',{A,B}}) ->
  908:     my_div(A, B);
  909: foo({'add',{A,B}}) ->
  910:     my_add(A, B);
  911: foo({'abs',X}) ->
  912:     my_abs(X);
  913: foo({error,Error}) -> 
  914:     erlang:error(Error);
  915: foo({throw,Throw}) ->
  916:     erlang:throw(Throw);
  917: foo({exit,Exit}) ->
  918:     erlang:exit(Exit);
  919: foo({raise,{Class,Reason}}) ->
  920:     erlang:raise(Class, Reason);
  921: foo(Term) when not is_atom(Term) -> Term.
  922: %%foo(Atom) when is_atom(Atom) -> % must not be defined!
  923: 
  924: my_div(A, B) ->
  925:     A div B.
  926: 
  927: my_add(A, B) ->
  928:     A + B.
  929: 
  930: my_abs(X) -> abs(X).
  931: 
  932: 
  933: last_call_optimization(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  934:     error = in_tail(dum),
  935:     StkSize0 = in_tail(0),
  936:     StkSize = in_tail(50000),
  937:     io:format("StkSize0 = ~p", [StkSize0]),
  938:     io:format("StkSize  = ~p", [StkSize]),
  939:     StkSize = StkSize0,
  940:     ok.
  941: 
  942: in_tail(E) ->
  943:     try erlang:abs(E) of
  944:         T ->
  945: 	    A = id([]),
  946: 	    B = id([]),
  947: 	    C = id([]),
  948: 	    id([A,B,C]),
  949: 	    do_tail(T)
  950:     catch error:badarg -> error
  951:     end.
  952: 
  953: do_tail(0) ->
  954:     process_info(self(), stack_size);
  955: do_tail(N) ->
  956:     in_tail(N-1).
  957: 
  958: bool(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  959:     ok = do_bool(false, false),
  960:     error = do_bool(false, true),
  961:     error = do_bool(true, false),
  962:     error = do_bool(true, true),
  963:     error = do_bool(true, blurf),
  964:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch do_bool(blurf, false)),
  965:     ok.
  966: 
  967: %% The following function used to cause a crash in beam_bool.
  968: do_bool(A0, B) ->
  969:     A = not A0,
  970:     try
  971: 	id(42),
  972: 	if
  973: 	    A, not B -> ok
  974: 	end
  975:     catch
  976: 	_:_ ->
  977: 	    error
  978:     end.
  979: 
  980: andalso_orelse(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  981:     {2,{a,42}} = andalso_orelse_1(true, {a,42}),
  982:     {b,{b}} = andalso_orelse_1(false, {b}),
  983:     {caught,no_tuple} = andalso_orelse_1(false, no_tuple),
  984: 
  985:     ok = andalso_orelse_2({type,[a]}),
  986:     also_ok = andalso_orelse_2({type,[]}),
  987:     also_ok = andalso_orelse_2({type,{a}}),
  988:     ok.
  989: 
  990: andalso_orelse_1(A, B) ->
  991:     {try
  992: 	 if
  993: 	     A andalso element(1, B) =:= a ->
  994: 		 tuple_size(B);
  995: 	     true ->
  996: 		 element(1, B)
  997: 	 end
  998:      catch error:_ ->
  999: 	     caught
 1000:      end,B}.
 1001: 
 1002: andalso_orelse_2({Type,Keyval}) ->
 1003:    try
 1004:        if is_atom(Type) andalso length(Keyval) > 0 -> ok;
 1005:           true -> also_ok
 1006:        end
 1007:    catch
 1008:        _:_ -> fail
 1009:    end.
 1010: 
 1011: zero() ->
 1012:     0.0.
 1013: 
 1014: get_in_try(_) ->
 1015:     undefined = get_valid_line([a], []),
 1016:     ok.
 1017: 
 1018: get_valid_line([_|T]=Path, Annotations) ->
 1019:     try
 1020:         get(Path)
 1021: 	%% beam_dead used to optimize away an assignment to {y,1}
 1022: 	%% because it didn't appear to be used.
 1023:     catch
 1024:         _:not_found ->
 1025:             get_valid_line(T, Annotations)
 1026:     end.
 1027: 
 1028: hockey(_) ->
 1029:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,_},[_|_]}} = (catch hockey()),
 1030:     ok.
 1031: 
 1032: hockey() ->
 1033:     %% beam_jump used to generate a call into the try block.
 1034:     %% beam_validator disapproved.
 1035:     receive _ -> (b = fun() -> ok end)
 1036:     + hockey, +x after 0 -> ok end, try (a = fun() -> ok end) + hockey, +
 1037:     y catch _ -> ok end.
 1038: 
 1039: 
 1040: -record(state, {foo}).
 1041: 
 1042: handle_info(_Config) ->
 1043:     do_handle_info({foo}, #state{}),
 1044:     ok.
 1045: 
 1046: do_handle_info({_}, State) ->
 1047:    handle_info_ok(),
 1048:    State#state{foo = bar},
 1049:    case ok of
 1050:    _ ->
 1051:      case catch handle_info_ok() of
 1052:      ok ->
 1053:        {stop, State}
 1054:      end
 1055:    end;
 1056: do_handle_info(_, State) ->
 1057:    (catch begin
 1058:      handle_info_ok(),
 1059:      State#state{foo = bar}
 1060:    end),
 1061:    case ok of
 1062:    _ ->
 1063:      case catch handle_info_ok() of
 1064:      ok ->
 1065:        {stop, State}
 1066:      end
 1067:    end.
 1068: 
 1069: handle_info_ok() -> ok.
 1070: 
 1071: 'catch_in_catch'(_Config) ->
 1072:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1073:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1074: 			     catch_in_catch_init(x),
 1075: 			     exit(good_exit)
 1076: 		     end),
 1077:     receive
 1078: 	{'EXIT',Pid,good_exit} ->
 1079: 	    ok;
 1080: 	Other ->
 1081: 	    io:format("Unexpected: ~p\n", [Other]),
 1082: 	    error
 1083:     after 32000 ->
 1084: 	    io:format("No message received\n"),
 1085: 	    error
 1086:     end.
 1087: 
 1088: 'catch_in_catch_init'(Param) ->
 1089:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1090:     %% The catches were improperly nested, causing a "No catch found" crash.
 1091:     (catch begin
 1092:            id(Param),
 1093:            (catch exit(bar))
 1094:        end
 1095:     ),
 1096:     ignore.
 1097: 
 1098: grab_bag(_Config) ->
 1099:     %% Thanks to Martin Bjorklund.
 1100:     _ = fun() -> ok end,
 1101:     try
 1102: 	fun() -> ok end
 1103:     after
 1104: 	fun({A, B}) -> A + B end
 1105:     end,
 1106: 
 1107:     %% Thanks to Tim Rath.
 1108:     A = {6},
 1109:     try
 1110: 	io:fwrite("")
 1111:     after
 1112: 	fun () ->
 1113: 		fun () -> {_} = A end
 1114: 	end
 1115:     end,
 1116: 
 1117:     %% Unnecessary catch.
 1118:     22 = (catch 22),
 1119: 
 1120:     fun() ->
 1121:             F = grab_bag_1(any),
 1122:             true = is_function(F, 1)
 1123:     end(),
 1124: 
 1125:     <<>> = grab_bag_2(whatever),
 1126: 
 1127:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_3()),
 1128: 
 1129:     true = grab_bag_4(),
 1130: 
 1131:     ok.
 1132: 
 1133: grab_bag_1(V) ->
 1134:     %% V will be stored in y0.
 1135:     try
 1136:         receive
 1137:         after 0 ->
 1138:                 %% y0 will be re-used for the catch tag.
 1139:                 %% This is safe, because there are no instructions
 1140:                 %% that can raise an exception.
 1141:                 catch 22
 1142:         end,
 1143:         %% beam_validator incorrectly assumed that the make_fun2
 1144:         %% instruction could raise an exception and end up at
 1145:         %% the catch part of the try.
 1146:         fun id/1
 1147:     catch
 1148:         %% Never reached, because nothing in the try body raises any
 1149:         %% exception.
 1150:         _:V ->
 1151:             ok
 1152:     end.
 1153: 
 1154: grab_bag_2(V) ->
 1155:     try
 1156:         %% y0 will be re-used for the catch tag.
 1157:         %% This is safe, because there are no instructions
 1158:         %% that can raise an exception.
 1159:         catch 22,
 1160: 
 1161:         %% beam_validator incorrectly assumed that the bs_init_writable
 1162:         %% instruction could raise an exception and end up at
 1163:         %% the catch part of the try.
 1164:         <<0 || [], #{} <- []>>
 1165:     catch
 1166:         %% Never reached, because nothing in the try body raises any
 1167:         %% exception.
 1168:         error:_ ->
 1169:             V
 1170:     end.
 1171: 
 1172: grab_bag_3() ->
 1173:     try 2 of
 1174:         true ->
 1175:             <<
 1176:               "" || [V0] = door
 1177:             >>
 1178:     catch
 1179:         error:true:V0 ->
 1180:             []
 1181:             %% The default clause here (which re-throws the exception)
 1182:             %% would not return two values as expected.
 1183:     end =:= (V0 = 42).
 1184: 
 1185: grab_bag_4() ->
 1186:     try
 1187:         erlang:yield()
 1188:     after
 1189:         %% beam_jump would do an unsafe sharing of blocks, resulting
 1190:         %% in an ambiguous_catch_try_state diagnostic from beam_validator.
 1191:         catch <<>> = size(catch ([_ | _] = ok))
 1192:     end.
 1193: 
 1194: 
 1195: stacktrace(_Config) ->
 1196:     V = [make_ref()|self()],
 1197:     case ?MODULE:module_info(native) of
 1198:         false ->
 1199:             {value2,{caught1,badarg,[{erlang,abs,[V],_}|_]}} =
 1200:                 stacktrace_1({'abs',V}, error, {value,V}),
 1201:             {caught2,{error,badarith},[{erlang,'+',[0,a],_},
 1202:                                        {?MODULE,my_add,2,_}|_]} =
 1203:                 stacktrace_1({'div',{1,0}}, error, {'add',{0,a}});
 1204:         true ->
 1205:             {value2,{caught1,badarg,[{?MODULE,my_abs,1,_}|_]}} =
 1206:                 stacktrace_1({'abs',V}, error, {value,V}),
 1207:             {caught2,{error,badarith},[{?MODULE,my_add,2,_}|_]} =
 1208:                 stacktrace_1({'div',{1,0}}, error, {'add',{0,a}})
 1209:     end,
 1210:     {caught2,{error,{try_clause,V}},[{?MODULE,stacktrace_1,3,_}|_]} =
 1211:         stacktrace_1({value,V}, error, {value,V}),
 1212:     {caught2,{throw,V},[{?MODULE,foo,1,_}|_]} =
 1213:         stacktrace_1({value,V}, error, {throw,V}),
 1214: 
 1215:     try
 1216:         stacktrace_2()
 1217:     catch
 1218:         error:{badmatch,_}:Stk2 ->
 1219:             [{?MODULE,stacktrace_2,0,_},
 1220:              {?MODULE,stacktrace,1,_}|_] = Stk2,
 1221:             ok
 1222:     end,
 1223: 
 1224:     try
 1225:         stacktrace_3(a, b)
 1226:     catch
 1227:         error:function_clause:Stk3 ->
 1228:             case lists:module_info(native) of
 1229:                 false ->
 1230:                     [{lists,prefix,[a,b],_}|_] = Stk3;
 1231:                 true ->
 1232:                     [{lists,prefix,2,_}|_] = Stk3
 1233:             end
 1234:     end,
 1235: 
 1236:     try
 1237:         throw(x)
 1238:     catch
 1239:         throw:x:_IntentionallyUnused ->
 1240:             ok
 1241:     end.
 1242: 
 1243: stacktrace_1(X, C1, Y) ->
 1244:     try try foo(X) of
 1245:             C1 -> value1
 1246:         catch
 1247:             C1:D1:Stk1 ->
 1248:                 {caught1,D1,Stk1}
 1249:         after
 1250:             foo(Y)
 1251:         end of
 1252:         V2 -> {value2,V2}
 1253:     catch
 1254:         C2:D2:Stk2 ->
 1255:             {caught2,{C2,D2},Stk2}
 1256:     end.
 1257: 
 1258: stacktrace_2() ->
 1259:     ok = erlang:process_info(self(), current_function),
 1260:     ok.
 1261: 
 1262: stacktrace_3(A, B) ->
 1263:     {ok,lists:prefix(A, B)}.
 1264: 
 1265: nested_stacktrace(_Config) ->
 1266:     V = [{make_ref()}|[self()]],
 1267:     value1 = nested_stacktrace_1({{value,{V,x1}},void,{V,x1}},
 1268:                                  {void,void,void}),
 1269:     case ?MODULE:module_info(native) of
 1270:         false ->
 1271:             {caught1,
 1272:              [{erlang,'+',[V,x1],_},{?MODULE,my_add,2,_}|_],
 1273:              value2} =
 1274:                 nested_stacktrace_1({{'add',{V,x1}},error,badarith},
 1275:                                     {{value,{V,x2}},void,{V,x2}}),
 1276:             {caught1,
 1277:              [{erlang,'+',[V,x1],_},{?MODULE,my_add,2,_}|_],
 1278:              {caught2,[{erlang,abs,[V],_}|_]}} =
 1279:                 nested_stacktrace_1({{'add',{V,x1}},error,badarith},
 1280:                                     {{'abs',V},error,badarg});
 1281:         true ->
 1282:             {caught1,
 1283:              [{?MODULE,my_add,2,_}|_],
 1284:              value2} =
 1285:                 nested_stacktrace_1({{'add',{V,x1}},error,badarith},
 1286:                                     {{value,{V,x2}},void,{V,x2}}),
 1287:             {caught1,
 1288:              [{?MODULE,my_add,2,_}|_],
 1289:              {caught2,[{?MODULE,my_abs,1,_}|_]}} =
 1290:                 nested_stacktrace_1({{'add',{V,x1}},error,badarith},
 1291:                                     {{'abs',V},error,badarg})
 1292:     end,
 1293:     ok.
 1294: 
 1295: nested_stacktrace_1({X1,C1,V1}, {X2,C2,V2}) ->
 1296:     try foo(X1) of
 1297:         V1 -> value1
 1298:     catch
 1299:         C1:V1:S1 ->
 1300:             T2 = try foo(X2) of
 1301:                      V2 -> value2
 1302:                  catch
 1303:                      C2:V2:S2 ->
 1304:                          {caught2,S2}
 1305:                  end,
 1306:             {caught1,S1,T2}
 1307:     end.
 1308: 
 1309: raise(_Config) ->
 1310:     test_raise(fun() -> exit({exit,tuple}) end),
 1311:     test_raise(fun() -> abs(id(x)) end),
 1312:     test_raise(fun() -> throw({was,thrown}) end),
 1313: 
 1314:     badarg = bad_raise(fun() -> abs(id(x)) end),
 1315: 
 1316:     error = stk_used_in_bin_size(<<0:42>>),
 1317:     ok.
 1318: 
 1319: stk_used_in_bin_size(Bin) ->
 1320:     try
 1321:         throw(fail)
 1322:     catch
 1323:         throw:fail:Stk ->
 1324:             %% The compiler would crash because the building of the
 1325:             %% stacktrack was sunk into each case arm.
 1326:             case Bin of
 1327:                 <<0:Stk>> -> ok;
 1328:                 _ -> error
 1329:             end
 1330:     end.
 1331: 
 1332: bad_raise(Expr) ->
 1333:     try
 1334:         Expr()
 1335:     catch
 1336:         _:E:Stk ->
 1337:             erlang:raise(bad_class, E, Stk)
 1338:     end.
 1339: 
 1340: test_raise(Expr) ->
 1341:     test_raise_1(Expr),
 1342:     test_raise_2(Expr),
 1343:     test_raise_3(Expr),
 1344:     test_raise_4(Expr).
 1345: 
 1346: test_raise_1(Expr) ->
 1347:     erase(exception),
 1348:     try
 1349:         do_test_raise_1(Expr)
 1350:     catch
 1351:         C:E:Stk ->
 1352:             {C,E,Stk} = erase(exception)
 1353:     end.
 1354: 
 1355: do_test_raise_1(Expr) ->
 1356:     try
 1357:         Expr()
 1358:     catch
 1359:         C:E:Stk ->
 1360:             %% Here the stacktrace must be built.
 1361:             put(exception, {C,E,Stk}),
 1362:             erlang:raise(C, E, Stk)
 1363:     end.
 1364: 
 1365: test_raise_2(Expr) ->
 1366:     erase(exception),
 1367:     try
 1368:         do_test_raise_2(Expr)
 1369:     catch
 1370:         C:E:Stk ->
 1371:             {C,E} = erase(exception),
 1372:             try
 1373:                 Expr()
 1374:             catch
 1375:                 _:_:S ->
 1376:                     [StkTop|_] = S,
 1377:                     [StkTop|_] = Stk
 1378:             end
 1379:     end.
 1380: 
 1381: do_test_raise_2(Expr) ->
 1382:     try
 1383:         Expr()
 1384:     catch
 1385:         C:E:Stk ->
 1386:             %% Here it is possible to replace erlang:raise/3 with
 1387:             %% the raw_raise/3 instruction since the stacktrace is
 1388:             %% not actually used.
 1389:             put(exception, {C,E}),
 1390:             erlang:raise(C, E, Stk)
 1391:     end.
 1392: 
 1393: test_raise_3(Expr) ->
 1394:     try
 1395:         do_test_raise_3(Expr)
 1396:     catch
 1397:         exit:{exception,C,E}:Stk ->
 1398:             try
 1399:                 Expr()
 1400:             catch
 1401:                 C:E:S ->
 1402:                     [StkTop|_] = S,
 1403:                     [StkTop|_] = Stk
 1404:             end
 1405:     end.
 1406: 
 1407: do_test_raise_3(Expr) ->
 1408:     try
 1409:         Expr()
 1410:     catch
 1411:         C:E:Stk ->
 1412:             %% Here it is possible to replace erlang:raise/3 with
 1413:             %% the raw_raise/3 instruction since the stacktrace is
 1414:             %% not actually used.
 1415:             erlang:raise(exit, {exception,C,E}, Stk)
 1416:     end.
 1417: 
 1418: test_raise_4(Expr) ->
 1419:     try
 1420:         do_test_raise_4(Expr)
 1421:     catch
 1422:         exit:{exception,C,E,StkTerm}:Stk ->
 1423:             %% it's not allowed to do the matching directly in the clause head
 1424:             true = (Stk =:= StkTerm),
 1425:             try
 1426:                 Expr()
 1427:             catch
 1428:                 C:E:S ->
 1429:                     [StkTop|_] = S,
 1430:                     [StkTop|_] = Stk
 1431:             end
 1432:     end.
 1433: 
 1434: do_test_raise_4(Expr) ->
 1435:     try
 1436:         Expr()
 1437:     catch
 1438:         C:E:Stk ->
 1439:             %% Here the stacktrace must be built.
 1440:             erlang:raise(exit, {exception,C,E,Stk}, Stk)
 1441:     end.
 1442: 
 1443: no_return_in_try_block(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1444:     1.0 = no_return_in_try_block_1(0),
 1445:     1.0 = no_return_in_try_block_1(0.0),
 1446: 
 1447:     gurka = no_return_in_try_block_1(gurka),
 1448:     [] = no_return_in_try_block_1([]),
 1449: 
 1450:     ok.
 1451: 
 1452: no_return_in_try_block_1(H) ->
 1453:     try
 1454:         Float = if
 1455:                     is_number(H) -> float(H);
 1456:                     true -> no_return()
 1457:                 end,
 1458:         Float + 1
 1459:     catch
 1460:         throw:no_return -> H
 1461:     end.
 1462: 
 1463: no_return() -> throw(no_return).
 1464: 
 1465: expression_export(_Config) ->
 1466:     42 = expr_export_1(),
 1467:     42 = expr_export_2(),
 1468: 
 1469:     42 = expr_export_3(fun() -> bar end),
 1470:     beer = expr_export_3(fun() -> pub end),
 1471:     {error,failed} = expr_export_3(fun() -> error(failed) end),
 1472:     is_42 = expr_export_3(fun() -> 42 end),
 1473:     no_good = expr_export_3(fun() -> bad end),
 1474: 
 1475:     <<>> = expr_export_4(<<1:32>>),
 1476:     <<"abcd">> = expr_export_4(<<2:32,"abcd">>),
 1477:     no_match = expr_export_4(<<0:32>>),
 1478:     no_match = expr_export_4(<<777:32>>),
 1479: 
 1480:     {1,2,3} = expr_export_5(),
 1481:     ok.
 1482: 
 1483: expr_export_1() ->
 1484:     try Bar = 42 of
 1485:         _ -> Bar
 1486:     after
 1487:         ok
 1488:     end.
 1489: 
 1490: expr_export_2() ->
 1491:     try Bar = 42 of
 1492:         _ -> Bar
 1493:     catch
 1494:         _:_ ->
 1495:             error
 1496:     end.
 1497: 
 1498: expr_export_3(F) ->
 1499:     try
 1500:         Bar = 42,
 1501:         F()
 1502:     of
 1503:         bar -> Bar;
 1504:         pub -> beer;
 1505:         Bar -> is_42;
 1506:         _ -> no_good
 1507:     catch
 1508:         error:Reason ->
 1509:             {error,Reason}
 1510:     end.
 1511: 
 1512: expr_export_4(Bin) ->
 1513:     try
 1514:         SzSz = id(32),
 1515:         Bin
 1516:     of
 1517:         <<Sz:SzSz,Tail:(4*Sz-4)/binary>> -> Tail;
 1518:         <<_/binary>> -> no_match
 1519:     after
 1520:         ok
 1521:     end.
 1522: 
 1523: expr_export_5() ->
 1524:     try
 1525:         X = 1,
 1526:         Z = 3,
 1527:         Y = 2
 1528:     of
 1529:         2 -> {X,Y,Z}
 1530:     after
 1531:         ok
 1532:     end.
 1533: 
 1534: %% GH-4953: Type inference in throw optimization could crash in rare
 1535: %% circumstances when a thrown type conflicted with one that was matched in
 1536: %% a catch clause.
 1537: throw_opt_crash(_Config) ->
 1538:     try
 1539:         throw_opt_crash_1(id(false), {pass, id(b), id(c)}),
 1540:         throw_opt_crash_1(id(false), {crash, id(b)}),
 1541:         ok
 1542:     catch
 1543:         throw:{pass, B, C} ->
 1544:             {error, gurka, {B, C}};
 1545:         throw:{beta, B, C} ->
 1546:             {error, gaffel, {B, C}};
 1547:         throw:{gamma, B, C} ->
 1548:             {error, grammofon, {B, C}}
 1549:     end.
 1550: 
 1551: throw_opt_crash_1(true, {_, _ ,_}=Term) ->
 1552:     throw(Term);
 1553: throw_opt_crash_1(true, {_, _}=Term) ->
 1554:     throw(Term);
 1555: throw_opt_crash_1(false, _Term) ->
 1556:     ok.
 1557: 
 1558: coverage(Config) ->
 1559:     {'EXIT',{{badfun,true},[_|_]}} = (catch coverage_1()),
 1560:     ok = coverage_ssa_throw(),
 1561:     error = coverage_pre_codegen(),
 1562:     {a,[42]} = do_plain_catch_list(42),
 1563:     cover_raise(Config),
 1564: 
 1565:     ok.
 1566: 
 1567: %% Cover some code in beam_trim.
 1568: coverage_1() ->
 1569:     try
 1570:         true
 1571:     catch
 1572:         law:business ->
 1573:             program
 1574:     after
 1575:         head
 1576:     end(0),
 1577:     if
 1578:         [2 or 1] ->
 1579:             true
 1580:     end.
 1581: 
 1582: %% Cover some code in beam_ssa_throw.
 1583: coverage_ssa_throw() ->
 1584:     cst_trivial(),
 1585:     cst_raw(),
 1586:     cst_stacktrace(),
 1587:     cst_types(),
 1588: 
 1589:     ok.
 1590: 
 1591: cst_trivial() ->
 1592:     %% never inspects stacktrace
 1593:     try
 1594:         cst_trivial_1()
 1595:     catch
 1596:         _C:_R:_S ->
 1597:             ok
 1598:     end.
 1599: 
 1600: cst_trivial_1() -> throw(id(gurka)).
 1601: 
 1602: cst_types() ->
 1603:     %% type tests
 1604:     try
 1605:         cst_types_1()
 1606:     catch
 1607:         throw:Val when is_atom(Val);
 1608:                        is_bitstring(Val);
 1609:                        is_binary(Val);
 1610:                        is_float(Val);
 1611:                        is_integer(Val);
 1612:                        is_list(Val);
 1613:                        is_map(Val);
 1614:                        is_number(Val);
 1615:                        is_tuple(Val) ->
 1616:             ok;
 1617:         throw:[_|_]=Cons when hd(Cons) =/= gurka;
 1618:                               tl(Cons) =/= gaffel ->
 1619:             %% is_nonempty_list, get_hd, get_tl
 1620:             ok;
 1621:         throw:Tuple when tuple_size(Tuple) < 5 ->
 1622:             %% tuple_size
 1623:             ok
 1624:     end.
 1625: 
 1626: cst_types_1() -> throw(id(gurka)).
 1627: 
 1628: cst_stacktrace() ->
 1629:     %% build_stacktrace
 1630:     try
 1631:         cst_stacktrace_1()
 1632:     catch
 1633:         throw:gurka ->
 1634:             ok;
 1635:         _C:_R:Stack ->
 1636:             id(Stack),
 1637:             ok
 1638:     end.
 1639: 
 1640: cst_stacktrace_1() -> throw(id(gurka)).
 1641: 
 1642: cst_raw() ->
 1643:     %% raw_raise
 1644:     try
 1645:         cst_raw_1()
 1646:     catch
 1647:         throw:gurka ->
 1648:             ok;
 1649:         _C:_R:Stack ->
 1650:             erlang:raise(error, dummy, Stack)
 1651:     end.
 1652: 
 1653: cst_raw_1() -> throw(id(gurka)).
 1654: 
 1655: %% Cover some code in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
 1656: coverage_pre_codegen() ->
 1657:     try not (catch 22) of
 1658:         true ->
 1659:             ok
 1660:     catch
 1661:         _:_ ->
 1662:             error
 1663:     end.
 1664: 
 1665: %% Cover some code in beam_block:alloc_may_pass/1.
 1666: do_plain_catch_list(X) ->
 1667:     B = [X],
 1668:     catch id({a,B}).
 1669: 
 1670: cover_raise(Config) ->
 1671:     UncertainClass = uncertain_class(Config),
 1672:     badarg = erlang:raise(UncertainClass, reason, []),
 1673:     BadClass = bad_class(Config),
 1674:     badarg = erlang:raise(BadClass, reason, []),
 1675:     ok.
 1676: 
 1677: uncertain_class(Config) ->
 1678:     case Config of
 1679:         [never_ever] ->  error;
 1680:         _ -> undefined_class
 1681:     end.
 1682: 
 1683: bad_class(Config) ->
 1684:     case Config of
 1685:         [never_ever] -> bad_class;
 1686:         _ -> also_bad
 1687:     end.
 1688: 
 1689: %% GH-7356: Funs weren't considered when checking whether an exception could
 1690: %% escape the module, erroneously triggering the optimization in some cases.
 1691: throw_opt_funs(_Config) ->
 1692:     try throw_opt_funs_1(id(a)) of
 1693:         _ -> unreachable
 1694:     catch
 1695:         _:Val -> a = id(Val)                    %Assertion.
 1696:     end,
 1697: 
 1698:     F = id(fun throw_opt_funs_1/1),
 1699: 
 1700:     try F(a) of
 1701:         _ -> unreachable
 1702:     catch
 1703:         _:_:Stack -> true = length(Stack) > 0   %Assertion.
 1704:     end,
 1705: 
 1706:     ok.
 1707: 
 1708: throw_opt_funs_1(a) ->
 1709:     throw(a);
 1710: throw_opt_funs_1(I) ->
 1711:     I.
 1712: 
 1713: id(I) -> I.
